info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 18 at 5:39PM MST until November 18 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 539 PM MST, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area leading to flash flooding along Big Bug Creek. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly along Big Bug Creek, the Aqua Fria River and surrounding drainages.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, normally dry washes, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott Valley, Dewey-Humboldt, Mayer, Spring Valley, Cordes Lakes, Agua Fria National Monument, Poland Junction, Cordes Junction and Arcosanti.
This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 263 and 284. Interstate 17 between mile markers 261 and 267.
This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Ash Creek, Lynx Creek, Big Bug Creek, Little Wolf Creek, Antelope Creek, Dry Creek, Sycamore Creek, Agua Fria River, Cedar Creek, Badger Spring Wash, Grapevine Creek and Wolf Creek.
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR BIG BUG CREEK AND THE AQUA FRIA RIVER IN YAVAPAI COUNTY
